website_summaries.verdict: While it isn't the most powerful blender on the market, it is a good choice for those that are budget-conscious and just want something to get the job done.
pros: Able to pulverize fibrous, hard, and soft ingredients
Interchangeable design makes it easy to switch different sized containers
cons: Not as powerful as some of the other models in our shortlist

customer_reviews.title: Loved using it almost every day, but it died a month and a half after buying.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was pretty awesome. I used it to make smoothies, pesto, peanut butter - and I probably used it every other day. I had the motor sitting on a shelf plugged in so that I could whip out one of the canisters and use it easy peasy, but today as I was making pesto (this was delivered on the 26th of April - less than two months after I bought it) the motor died. I was flabbergasted. This thing is awesome, but it died so quickly!
customer_reviews.author: M. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great for making smoothies and protein shakes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender specifically for making smoothies and protein shakes. Its great for crushing ice and mixing thick liquids because of the powerful motor and has no problem slicing thru any fruits because of the sharp blades.
customer_reviews.author: Bilal Farhan

customer_reviews.title: Motor stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The motor stopped working on my device a month and a half after ordering. Was not able to return to Amazon at this time, and Ninja warranty specifies I must pay shipping costs both ways to have device repaired/replaced, which is just as expensive as buying an entirely new unit! I should have looked into the fine print before buying to make sure it was a true warranty. Will not buy again. Probably going to toss in the trash and find a different brand. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the First Use
customer_reviews.text: What the heck? I purchased this over a year ago when my 33 year old Hamilton Beach blender finally died. I hardly ever use a blender, but wanted to have one on hand for when I need it. Took it out of the box for the first time yesterday to blend 16 oz. frozen berries with sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice to make sorbet. The motor burned out the first time I used it!!! I don't know what recourse I have since I had it so long before using. I purchased this based on the reviews. What a major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Huffmadz

customer_reviews.title: Bottom will crack not super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on average twice a week. Mostly for smoothies and blending vegetables. Works great as far as blending but does not hold up over time. We purchased ours September 2017. The bottom of the small container cracked a month ago and today the large container started doing the same. We hand wash the blender and don’t abuse it. On top of this problem, it has a lot of crevices to clean out. Disapponted but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: drager

customer_reviews.title: Used with missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I received an already used, taped together box with 2/8 pieces included.... I already requested a replacement and will update if I receive that and can actually use that if not I’ll be requesting a return/refund! I’ve never left a bad review but I’m honestly in shock at how horrible this is.
customer_reviews.author: Alannis Minnerly

customer_reviews.title: This blender is fantastic. I bought it over a year ago because ...
customer_reviews.text: This blender is fantastic. I bought it over a year ago because I love smoothies and milkshakes and wanted something powerful that would make sure there are no ice chunks in my mixed drinks. I was not disappointed. I have had no problems with the blender. It's easy to use and clean. I have also used the full sized Ninja blender (my roommate had one), but this little one works just as well. Great value for the price. Update: It's been another year since I wrote this review and the blender still works great. I love it. Best purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ninja Blade Mod
customer_reviews.text: Have had this blender for three years now and I will share a life hack for others wanting a higher cutting blade. If you notice from my picture you simply take the upper removable blade assembly and cut 1" off the top. Take that piece and slide it down the main blade acting as the spacer. That piece has a slight taper to it so you can choose from two heights depending on which end you use. Then place the top blade back onto the main. The last step which is to drill a hole through the upper and put a 1/8" or so bolt and nylon nut....Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: amazonsteve1234

customer_reviews.title: Good bye Food Processor and Hello Ninja.....
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I bought this I figured I would use it to make slushes for my 7yr old grandson this summer.... he loved the slushes especially since when he asked for them it was 123 and they were ready for him It so happened that one day I took down my elaborate food processor to grind my herbs to make seasoning I realized it had stopped working....so I took down my Ninja and guess what??? It worked much better and faster than my big time food processor.... and, it was much easier to clean....so, I put the whole big food processing machine in the garbage and I said "Good Bye Food Processor and Hello Ninja"
customer_reviews.author: IsAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful
customer_reviews.text: I sliced my finger w/ one of blades putting it together and it bleed like crazy I probably needed stitches but I used emergency laceration closure bandage and was able to stop finally stop the bleeding. Other than that it's a great blender we made iced coffees and they were great. I can’t wait to make other drinks. To. Bad I don't drink alcohol anymore but my son is old enough now and does. It also makes great crushed ice. This blender is so powerful you will be surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Overheated and melted plastic, welding components together
customer_reviews.text: I had only used the food processor a handful of times before today since purchasing it a few months ago. While using the food processor (for only a few seconds, might I add), I noticed STEAM coming out of the top. The power of the spinner-top had MELTED the rubber/plastic around the removable blade handle, causing it to weld stuck to the lid. It is impossible to remove now. Although it is possible to still use and clean (although awkward), I don't feel comfortable using it again since I am now worried that pieces of plastic will get into my food. It would be nice to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: NFE

customer_reviews.title: Not so good!
customer_reviews.text: Had a previous version of this for many years and was very satisfied until a few cracks in the bottom of container formed. Consequently, I ordered this one and already the large container has 3 cracks in the bottom and even is leaking. I use it every morning to make our nutritional drink...not too hard of a job. The blade which is a 2 piece item also has stopped spinning both blades! I think 3 months is not a satisfactory amount of time. VERY disappointed! Now to find a quality product for this job. I was going to send one to our daughter but now now.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle A. Ostby

customer_reviews.title: No power, burnt-up first time used
customer_reviews.text: I had this about 10 months before I used it. I tried to chop frozen strawberries with it the first time out. It worked great for a few minutes then it stopped and I smelled burning plastic. It never worked again. I tried to use the 1 year warranty (says free shipping back to them). They wanted me to pay over $16 shipping since it was purchased more than 6 months earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Weiland

customer_reviews.title: Large pitcher needs 3 blades BADLY. Is this a knockoff?
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize that there are two versions of this product. Do not order this one, even tho it is billed as "Amazon's Choice" ! Choose the 450 watt version which has three spaced out blades for the larger pitcher so that it can actually blend ingredients when filled almost to the top. I now realize that the one I have, and wanted to replace, is the 450 watt. The blades for the pitcher on the 400 watt version (the replacement I bought) do nothing. I realized this by reading these reviews. That led me to wonder is this REALLY a Ninja, or a knockoff of the real deal? Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it minimally to make some test smoothies,go to have my last 13 TUFUS pulled in the A.M then come the dentures -YIKES!- Based on my ;limmited use this appears it will be a keeper and will get a lot of use for smoothies /grinding nuts etc. as I have a strict weight loss nutrition program to follow to dump 70 lbs in the course of the next year - I believe this little guy will be the silver bullet for prepping things that will allow me to maintain solid nutrition as I adjust to recover from getting dentures.C Very Powerful,easy to operate and clean I like it money well spent as long as it has longevity
customer_reviews.author: Floyd T. Turbo

customer_reviews.title: Warrany Gotcha
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer said, they will attempt to charge you $20 dollars shipping if any of the parts break (Which they will, the power motor on mine burnt out mixing pre-workout after 5 months of using the blender less than once a week). I paid 27$ dollars for the blender, it does not make sense to pay 20 dollars to replace a part that could potentially break again in a year. Was a great product while working, but cannot approve of the tactics used by Ninja to avoid losing money on product failures while in the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wow just received the item. The first order was refunded for some reason but I placed the order again and omg I feel like such a grown up. Very affordable for what you get. I can’t find a decent food processor blender combo for anywhere near $34. Really great buy I have owned it for less that an hour and already made chutney meat marinade and a smoothie. The blades grind very well. My chutney marinade and smoothie were ground to perfection. I can see to many uses for this. Easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Product itself is great, packaging was badly damaged in shipment.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Ninja as a gift. I have one of my own that I love. When this one arrived, the box was badly damaged and the blender blades were missing. I don’t believe this was the fault of Amazon or the seller, more of a shipment problem. The product itself worked fine when I checked and was not damaged. I called the manufacturer and they quickly sent a replacement blade, so all was well. I will just have to put it in another box before I gift it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hennings

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 12 months, and asked me to pay $22 to cover shipping of replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit less than a year ago, and the engine in the motor stopped working. I called Ninja to ask for a replacement (since the item was still under warranty), and although they agreed to send me a new one, they asked me to cover the shipping, which apparently is $22, which seems ridiculous, especially considering that a brand-new unit with two new blender/containers is only $35. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and I was excited to use it I blended up small ice. As I was eating I kept biting hard things so I thought there we still some ice chunks. Then I noticed I couldn’t bite what I thought was “ice”, then I found out it was broken shards of the blender in my mouth. I am very angry because I made my 3 year old nephew a snow cone with shards of plastic in it.
customer_reviews.author: Chanice K.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Spend Your Money On
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst purchase I have made. I bought a year ago and used maybe 5 times. It was hard to get to work every time. I thought it was me but you would think I could get it right at least once. Last night I was going to make smoothies, not anything major just smoothies. Tried it in the large one first then went to the small one. I am tired of trying to figure out if it is the connections or the powerhead. It is going in the garbage. I expected more from ninja.
customer_reviews.author: TRIPPINFORWARD

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great for Frappés and Almond Butter!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful! I just made homemade almond butter for the first time ever and it worked like a charm. I was worried it would overheat and it definitely got warm but it powered through. I will never buy almond butter again...can't wait to try macadamia nut butter next! I also made a coffee frappé with espresso, coconut milk, ice, and some cacao nibs. Refreshing! Very pleased...not all of us can afford to fork over $500 for a fancy blender.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: The product I received is obviously not "brand new". The box was not taped at all, the parts was placed top on each other, the inserts were crushed in the bottom of the box. I am returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Island

customer_reviews.title: Cracks on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: We love it while it is in working condition. However, this is the second one that has cracked on the bottom & will not hold liquids. For it to happen one time is odd but possible, but to receive a new one, & it happens again to that one? Very questionable. Both only lasted 1-2 months. Amazon closed the return schedule to a month for this last one, so I am unable to return it & am stuck with a non-usable blender. Very disappointed. Expected better quality with this.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: It survives for 7 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing back in 2013. Admittedly I don't use it all the time, but I have used it quite a bit. I got it while I was in the Navy in Norfolk VA, then took it with me to Spain, then back to Norfolk, then 3 different homes in Missouri. So mine has seen some of the world.....and it still works....it's a really good old set up. If I ever get a new blender/food processor set up, I'll likely go with the same brand because it's been pretty good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: motor burned up on second use
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this item until using it the second time. It suddenly stopped and I smelled a distinct burnt odor. Either use it VERY carefully or don't buy it! Oh, and also be very careful with the blades and DON'T let kids around it. Even being careful (having read reviews), I cut my fingers twice cleaning them, once pretty deeply! If I could just by the motor cheaply, I would try again, but the motor alone is as much as the entire package, so no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this Ninja blender it's so much powerful than the average blender. It is easy to clean. The food processor is great to. When I use the food processor. I take off one of the blades to chop up vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: loveshopping

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this Ninja to chop veggies and fresh herbs. A task I do every day. Gets the job done in seconds. Need chopped onion? 2 seconds later....chopped. Just rinse the bowl and blade and all done. I have yet to use the pitcher, but the chopper bowl is AWESOME. It is great quality. The only thing I wish it had was more pronounced grooves on the motor unit so I could pick it up with one hand. The motor is fairly heavy and really requires two hand since it does not have any spot to get a good grip to lift it. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: The top blade is held to the bottom blade with ...
customer_reviews.text: The top blade is held to the bottom blade with a plastic tab. This promptly sheared off. Now the top blade does not work. There is no reason to have this in two pieces. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeJeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Meet my expectation. Best part easy to handle and easy to clean. We eat dumplings lot, now we don't have to buy ground meat. We do it ourself and it is lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Keshav Bhandari

customer_reviews.title: The motor will not last.
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a ninja blender for years now and finally got it. Would have been fantastic if it hadn't stopped working 1 month and 9 days after I purchased it. The motor stopped in the middle of blending my iced coffee. I'm very disappointed as I dont have money to waste and really needed a blender for all the cooking and drinks that I make at home.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Used listed as new
customer_reviews.text: I just received my product and I am disappointed. This item was not new as described. Once I opened the box, the box that the item comes in was open. The pieces were put in the box but it wasn't packed correctly. I don't have time to open everything up but if it is I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Fatimah

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but can't change the speed settings
customer_reviews.text: My friend bought this product several months before I bought it, which helped me understand the product a bit from seeing her use it. I really like this product, and love the fact that it comes with both a blender and a food chopper. However, one thing that it does not have is settings. The motor chops/blends the food at the same speed, no matter what. I've learned over the months of having this that if I have just a few items to blend together, it works best by using the food chopper cup instead of the blender. Otherwise, I have large chunks that aren't blended well. Other than that, I do love the product. Just took some adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Intefada

customer_reviews.title: This is not an attachment for a ninja it is a totally separate electrical item
customer_reviews.text: This is not an attachment for a ninja it is a totally separate electrical item. I thought it would fit on my ninja and I don’t need all of the extra pieces. I tried to blend up a smoothie with crushed ice and it wouldn’t even blend the crushed ice. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: suki

customer_reviews.title: Great product true to its YouTube reviews
customer_reviews.text: Bought for mom for christmas, she threw out her old nasty blender and is now using this on the daily. Works great, chops great and got it for about 28$ during the holiday deal season. Actually blends like all the YouTube reviews say it does. And its true about being able to blend ice cubes into a super thin, snow like product. Instead of just crushing them into broken pieces like a regular blender would. BUY!! I just throw in avocados, tomatoes, Onion and it chops it right up and makes guacamole for me:). Just be sure not to blend for too long, 3 pumps should be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Yerena

customer_reviews.title: With regular use, lasts one year max.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we've bought. For the price we figured, why not. But the same problem keeps happening...the part where the two blades connect keeps wearing away-when that happens it's useless. It no longer blends. I'm not doing anything crazy with it...just smoothies and protein shakes on a fairly regular basis. So disappointed. The first one lasted 10 months, and the second one lasted less. Now I'm in search of another blender...perhaps I can convince the hubs to finally spring for the Vita mix! 😁
customer_reviews.author: A&R

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy connector
customer_reviews.text: Ninja chopper are great and awesome but then their blender connection is hexagonal star made of plastic which wears out quick especially, connection is not tight. I looked for so many places and hours but could not find a plastic replacement thus purchasing a new unit to replace a single connector. This is my third purchase, so I have closet full of containers.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: It works great, When you put on the top with flour inside it will puff a little out, so put top on slowly, it rinses out ok, but my only sink is in the restroom ( one room apartment) so I’m back and forth a lot. As far as blending it’s great, and rinses out easily. I looked at Walmart and everything they sell was more expensive and not as good in my opinion. I would buy it again , thumbs up 👍
customer_reviews.author: K4gwb

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how much I needed this thing in my life. I have a larger Ninja blender but not all recipes call for you to use such a big machine. This makes smaller tasks like crepes and smoothies and breeze. I love that you can store it with a separate lid (crepe batter must chill 30 mins). It is easy to use, and understand, and it is lightweight. I love the Ninja brand, and this was definitely a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Nice blender, but broken blade (twice)
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product twice. Thought it was a fluke but both times the top blade has broken. It wore through the plastic notch it’s supposed to sit in and instead spins around doing absolutely nothing. So basically it only works for tiny smoothies now. Aside from that issue it is a nice product, with a crappy blade. Happened within one month of owning. Wouldn’t buy a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Clements

customer_reviews.title: Has blended everything smoothly and easily, including frozen fruits and ice
customer_reviews.text: The Ninja is great at blending and includes two pitchers and tight fitting lids. It does well with ice and frozen fruits without any problem, unlike many personal blenders that lack the power for frozen items and burn out quickly. I've only had it about a month, but it is used several times a week: sometimes per day. It is very easy to use. The blades are very sharp, so be careful when cleaning, otherwise cleaning is easy. I would recommend it and would buy it again myself if I needed another.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Troubling, damaged, incomplete and odd.
customer_reviews.text: This was very confusing, only one pitcher in the box, in place of the large picture was a envelope with books in Japanese! The ninja motor unit was scratched and scuffed and the box looked like it had been through a blender. I’m not sure what to think of it but this was bad.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Krantz

customer_reviews.title: Wow- this thing blends great! Perfect thick smoothies and shakes using frozen fruit ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow- this thing blends great! Perfect thick smoothies and shakes using frozen fruit etc...the blades are great but the plastic that it is made of is not the highest quality. A piece of the plastic lid broke off on the first use, a replacement lid would be nice but the cracked piece does not impact the integrity of the blender just aesthetics and a slightly sharp edge (too lazy to ship all the equipment back and order a new one just for the lid) Other than that, this is a great price for what you get. Just be careful with the plastic especially if you're used to a heavy duty glass blender like I am- it is much more fragile!
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item many more times over than I ever expected to. Smoothies, hummus, peanut butter, frozen drinks, etc. Never a problem at all. Top lid can be mildly difficult to clean thoroughly if I make something sticky like peanut butter but that's a minor quibble. Of all the things I've bought on Amazon over the years this is probably my favorite purchase. Love it, love it, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: good, but beware cleaning crevices
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after my nutribullet conked out after 4 uses. Happy to say this item is still working well for me after a year, using weekly. My only major issue with it is that it has small crevices in various places that are impossible to clean, either by dishwasher or hand. In the pitcher handle, inside the chopper blade, and even in the splash guard. I've also tried soaking it in various liquid cleaning solutions, to no avail. The motor continues to work fine after heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Awful packaging and missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Ninja Master Prep with the blender's lid missing, the bowl lid is very different from the original shown in the box, and there was no real packaging to protect the product. This blender arrived in its own packaging, not even inside a bigger box for better protection. I'm returning this ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra I.

customer_reviews.title: Helps make food prep easier, but...
customer_reviews.text: This product allowed me to make smoothies easily and helped me stay on my diet plan! Easy to use and clean! Like the idea of a smaller container for those small jobs! I've had it now for several months and recently it started intermittently failing to run when I depressed the switch in the head. It appears that the trigger tab underneath that is supposed to depress when it is properly placed on the lid is sticking sometimes and isn't always depressing. After poking it with a toothpick or small screwdriver a couple of times, it appears to free up and work. May wind up returning this if it continues!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cant handle greens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for green smoothies. I hated it from the first day. It doesn't blend greens smooth. It can't handle a full blender of greens, requiring opening it and pushing it down and/or adding slowly. In addition, it only runs when you keep your hand on it, so you can't set it to run and walk away. After about 1 year of wrestling it daily, the upper blade stopped catching on the post so it just floats without grinding, effectively leaving only the lower blade = even less effective. Finally I'm replacing it with a low-end Oster like I used to have, which at least blended well even if it had similar problems handing volume.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Shap

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power in this product.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t hesitate to buy this product. Love it for my keto shakes, making salsa, prepping cauliflower rice, etc. Lots of power in a smaller machine. Great that it comes with 2 plastic containers, one large & one small. The blades are sharp but I haven’t cut myself yet. I also have a VitaMix but I use that for making soups, juicing & bigger jobs. Wish the power cord was a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: deniska

customer_reviews.title: My margarita travel blender!!!
customer_reviews.text: I travel for work and my margaritas are spoken of in hushed and reverent tones... This set is easy to carry in my car and cleans up well. Ice chunks are rare and it purees fresh or frozen fruit such as strawberries or mangos like a champ. I have two, one to travel and one in my home.
customer_reviews.author: TrappinGramma

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It worked great! (See how I used past tense?) The motor was kind of cumbersome to use since it's heavy, smooth, and hard to grasp for those with smaller hands. The blending action was great and we used it a couple of times a week. It certainly didn't last as long as I'd hoped. We went to use it and....nothing. It's dead.
customer_reviews.author: Buzy Mom

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Haven’t used the food processor and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Haven’t used the food processor and I have had it for a few months now. So I can’t say much about that BUT the blender is wonderful. It crushes Ice nicely though you have to hold it down to make sure it doesn’t lift everything and unlatch the motor, not a big deal after you figure it out! My favorite thing is how easy the blender is to clean! No rubber seals around the blades to have to clean. For most things I can just rinse it out then fill it with hot soapy water and run the blender and it about does it! Definitely a great blender especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Niki/ Clay

customer_reviews.title: Win some . lose some...that's life
customer_reviews.text: This product only worked once. I tried make snow ice.it wouldn't turn . I kept pushing the button.finally it turned once... Usually have good success with their products but this one was faulty...it happens.disappointed but their produccts are always great so maybe this was a bad batch. Ill just count my loss I guess this time..not go in my to post office t ok return corona has me scared to leave the house..too many health issues
customer_reviews.author: TOINETTE

customer_reviews.title: Motor not as powerful as my other two.
customer_reviews.text: I already have two of these Ninja sets. I am very pleased with both of them. This one will not last very long. The motor bogs down with something as light as tomatoes. I bought this for travel, but I'll probably take one of my old standby when on the road.. This was supposed to be a new item, not refurbished. Oh well, I'll get what use I can out of it.
customer_reviews.author: 1bootscooter

customer_reviews.title: Gets
customer_reviews.text: The blender gets most jobs done, but small pieces of food get trapped in crevices in the lid and are impossible to get out, whether you use small brushes, soak it, or put in the dishwasher. I had to toss mine because it was getting too dirty. Previously I would have to put aluminum foil under the lid to prevent food particles from touching the lid- very annoying! Also, my blender began leaking after a few years of use. This is an “ok” blender.
customer_reviews.author: LawDawg101

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying this blender! My husband is a chef and he loves it too! Our first one lasted us years until I thought boiling the lid in hot water was a good idea to clean it...it wasn't. So I ordered a whole new set. I would buy these as gifts and buy again! Blending power is amazing. I make smoothies all the time-works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought one in 2015 and this one in 2018. They are getting cheap in the motor , my 2015 motor is stronger . Not worth it until they stop making weak motors .
customer_reviews.author: Mr &Mrs Thomas baur

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July 2014. Just threw it out on my last move because the blades had dulled after about 200 uses and there was some grime built up in the motor part. I made smoothies weekly with it (ice, frozen fruits/vegetables, protein powder, milk) and put all the parts in the dishwasher after. It doesn't blend to a fine liquid but it does a lot better than it looks! Buying the QB1004 version now, only because it looks sleeker but I definitely recommend this blender unless you are blending real tough stuff or need to liquefy your blends.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. First time I opened the box and plugged it in to use it it shorted and started smoking. Got a replacement one and it did the exact same thing. Had to return them but ALSO had to PAY for shipping which was over 50€. Ridiculous. DO NOT BUY THIS! Waste of money and definitely not worth it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: They really need to test the mid to long term life span and quality of this product before marketing and selling it.
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine for a month or so. Afterwards it starts shredding the plastic parts of the stem into your foods. Eventually the blades will not be able to spin. Good thing I purchased the extended warranty. Will not be even attempting to buy another. They really need to test the mid to long term life span and quality of this product before marketing and selling it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I had a Ninja food chopper that I dropped and broke. I was looking to replace it with a new one and found the food chopper and blender kit. I love it. I have not had a blender in years. Now we use it everyday to make healthy smoothies for afternoon snack. The food chopper works great too.
customer_reviews.author: Ginefer Christy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I actually own 2 Ninja's. I bought this one for chopping up dog food for my puppy and it does an excellent job. The container got a little scratched up but that was to be expected. I have a few Ninja products and will continue to buy this brand as it works very well. I use my other Ninja to crush ice for slushies for my kids, it does everything and keeps going. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan 1978

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, blends well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the reputation of Ninja products. It is very easy to use. If you are looking for a super creamy blend, just know that this one does not do that. It leaves some ice chunks. But for a standard protein shake, or to chop onions, its perfect. I leave mine out on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: MORNING SMOOTHIES ARE A SNAP!!
customer_reviews.text: Have been making morning smoothies with this gadget for over a month. Nothing it can't handle. Icecubes, frozen fruit, you name it. It does a great job, and I can't live without it. REALLY easy cleanup. Wish there was a way to hold the button down without a person holding it, but for 30 bucks, that's a small price to pay for such a great blender/processor. LOVE THIS. *I was NOT compensated in any way for this review, and I paid full price for the product. *UPDATE We still use this daily. I did have to buy a replacement blade, but the motor is still going strong. Excellent product for smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: KachinaDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Had it for a few months and wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: We have been using it for everything. Making baby puree and cutting meat for baby to consume easier. Making smoothies, wife put ice and fruit. Easy to clean. we never fill it up all the way. It is very sharp and has stayed sharp so far. Both cut ourselves, it is easy to clean but is weird to hold blades to clean. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fer & Sara

customer_reviews.title: My Ninja Motor is a Failure
customer_reviews.text: These products look like they are in superb condition and of great quality. I have used this blender and food processor 2 or 3 times since I've bought this in January 2019. It's mid-May and I've decided to pull these babies out to test a fun drink recipe. I was sorely disappointed, the motor is a dud. Conclusion: This product stops working in 1.5 yrs and I have only used the motor 2-3 times. Now I just have dead items taking space in my small NYC apartment. Is Ninja an eco-friendly company? Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I have ordered three and two out of three motors have not worked.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Ninja 400 Blender/Food Processor for my home and it works perfectly, I liked it so much, I ordered a second one for my vacation home, however, the motor didn’t work. I called Amazon, they sent me a replacement, the motor on the replacement didn’t work either. Called again, going to try one more replacement bc my original works so well and I love it. Let’s see what happens, hope it works. I gave it two stars bc of the hassle of returning but the original is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great but Short Lived
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple months and it has worked great for everything I've used it for. (Mostly smoothies with ice, mashed cauliflower, etc). It's easy to clean and much nicer than a traditional blender. I would highly recommend this product. EDIT: These plastic containers cannot tolerate any heat. I used them to make mashed cauliflower, pureed squash, etc and they will crack from the metal post at the bottom all the way up the sides! Very dissatisfied that I will have to buy a new containers (if available) to replace my broken ones. Cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with "old" model
customer_reviews.text: This "model" is the same as my old one, however, the motor and blade are different. Heads up if your planning on piecing your old one
customer_reviews.author: Ayman Hawari

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Two Appliances with this Ninja Master Prep - Hooray!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to make single serve (or more) smoothies. Although I have a Ninja Kitchen Pro, I wasn't able to purchase a small blender option for my model and I wanted something with a smaller footprint for everyday use. This neat little Master Prep replaced two older appliances : a small personal blender and a small grinder/chopper that I had for years - both of which had seen better times. With limited storage and counter top space, replacing two appliances with one makes a big difference. The Master Prep works exactly as promised and is a cinch to clean. After each use, fill with water, add dish detergent, turn on and let it wash itself.
customer_reviews.author: NC Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This was my second ninja, the first I had(still have) for 5 years . the first one is used almost daily, and is awesome I purchased this second one to take to my office, as I drink a protein shake daily, and this was the best way to accomplish this without lugging it back and forth. Unfortunately, after 5 months of 4 uses a week, the motor has stopped working. I always used the pulse method, so it was never running for more than a few seconds at a time. I do not know why this happened, and it is disappointing. Back to just one for now :(
customer_reviews.author: michele richard

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the same blender. The first one was three years old and the blade blew on the tall canister. This newer model is easier to clean. I suggest putting the blades on the top rack of the dish washer instead of the silverware rack. They get stuck all the time. Great power and speed. We use this daily!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of four

customer_reviews.title: Hummus and Smoothies: YES
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations, like really low. I had a much nicer (read expensive) blender that I was gifted and it couldn't do what I needed. I need three things from a blender: hummus, smoothies, and margaritas. I made hummus the day I got this and it was amazing, zero issues with the hummus (60 seconds top and that's will adding my extras). I made mango sorbet with frozen mango and coconut milk perfectly blended with no problems. Haven't tried the margaritas but don't foresee that being an issue. I've been tossing it into the dishwasher after rinsing it and haven't had any issues so far. For just under $30 buy it for goodness sakes!
customer_reviews.author: Jillianhour

customer_reviews.title: shipping is the problem
customer_reviews.text: I have one and bought this one for a gift. It works great easy to clean and everything, but Amazon needs to do better on shipping this. They shipped it as is and mine got beat up definitely doesn't look new. I hope it's okay still.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Returned Immediately
customer_reviews.text: I returned this blender immediately after opening. The blender turned on and seemed to run fine, but I did not trust it to last based on the condition it came in. The pitcher/bowl were scratched up on the insides from the blades not being secured, and on the outside there were also scratches and chips from pieces also not being secured or wrapped . I believe this product had been opened and possibly used before I got it (I was purchasing brand-new).
customer_reviews.author: Kyla

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: You will note in the photo I show where suds remained in the handle. This doesn't seem to hurt anything and the suds disappear in a few minutes. I would not let this deter you from purchasing. VERY powerful, easy to use and to clean. Really a super value for this much power and versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Garland

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: That this Ninja isn't living up to it's name. I have other Ninja products that I love. Unfortunately I have only used this a few times...it burned out quickly in the middle of trying to blend frozen banana and almond butter - which is one of the main reasons I puchased this item. The unit took a while to cool down and the burn smell to go away.
customer_reviews.author: StokedJourneys

customer_reviews.title: BEST. BLENDER. EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Forget the $100, $200, or even $500 blenders-- this is ALL you need in life! Seriously... $500 for a blender? I think not! When I saw that this had great reviews, I just had to try it. So far, I've used it almost every day for the past four months. Whether I'm making my morning smoothie, salsa, soups, or baby food-- this bad boy has never disappointed me. Easy to clean, made from durable materials, and easily transportable. (Hello, camping cold drinks!) I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you wanna make a smoothy
customer_reviews.text: I Just got this blender based on the great reviwels but Im not impressed ,its ease to use if you dont mind taking the time to hold on the top of the lid to blend your portions anyway this blender has no power to make a decente smoothy and has less power then a regular blender .Forget about detox juices ...it leaves all the residus ....vey unsatisfied .
customer_reviews.author: claudia

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of reviews on here, I decided to give the Ninja a try. I like to have smoothies very often because I have jaw problems. This ninja worked OK for about 6 months. It crushes ice to my satisfaction, about the same as any other blender out there- no better or worse. The problem is that after 6 months, the blender stopped working. At first it started only working if you pressed down on the button really, really hard. It required so much pressure to get it to work, that even my husband had difficulty getting it to work. Then it stopped working all together. I am very disappointed and will not buy another ninja.
customer_reviews.author: Dione M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and chops everything quick
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this set for a month or 2 already and love it! Easy to clean because the blades are removable and it crushes ice fast. The first time I used it I tried making guacamole and it turned to a purée really fast. So you really Only need a couple pulses. I have made smoothies and sauces with it. Salsa and homemade tomato sauce are really easy to make with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Upon seeing the box it was all messed up and looked half open, it was missing the main piece that makes it work and the tops as soon as I pulled what was there out of the box, the blade cut me and I haven't stopped bleeding since. Horrible experience never again ! So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Brookey b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect not only for smoothies but also for indian dishes:) loved it
customer_reviews.text: Just luved my new Ninja. It's perfect for indian cooking. Make purie wth almost as small as 1-2 qty of tomatos or onions and as big as 10-15 qty (refer pic- onion paste wth one big onion & tomato purie wth 3 tomatoes & Spinach paste wth one bunch). It worked perfect & I made my kids fav indian palak paneer dish today. But yes u need to be careful with the blades. Very handy and no noise item. After use u can just store it inside your pantry too. Thanks Ninja for this awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My magic bullett died. This was a great price so I tried it. Really works well with double blades in both containers. Lots of power. Try milk, diet soda and ice and you will get the best “. Milk shake! I put protein powder in mine too. This makes two shakes. Very good.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: Holy smokes, this thing chops!! I've been trying to find a new smoothie maker (I didn't spend too much on my old one) and came across this great deal on Amazon. My mother owns one of the more expensive Ninja's and persuaded me to make the purchase. I made one of my breakfast smoothies (with frozen fruit because my old one couldn't handle ice for whatever reason) and was shocked by how easily it assembled and how fast the smoothie was made! My only complaint is I wish it came with more containers, but I guess I'll be using more glasses than normal now.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it broke
customer_reviews.text: Two months and the large pitcher has a crack and is leaking. Loved this blender for making bulletproof coffee. I haven't contacted Ninja about the 1 year limited warranty yet...although their site says they charge for return shipping after they repair/replace. Only paid about $25 for the whole set, not sure it's worth it (assuming they cover the repair anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Duder

customer_reviews.title: Great starter blender/food processor
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this tool. Only con is the size of the food processor part, it is quite small. I’m going to look into a larger vessel and lid for it. Otherwise it’s a good product, blender is good and processor is also. I like that it’s controlled by the top pod contraption, not the typical bottom blend situation. Easier to clean and nothing gets stuck on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you are expecting anything more than a chopper, look elsewhere. Not able to purée or make a paste. Smoothies are still full of bits & pieces.
customer_reviews.author: FitPro56

customer_reviews.title: Broke too soon!
customer_reviews.text: This Ninja worked well for a a few weeks but then the plastic for the center blades stopped fitting into the bottom attachment. It was very strange. I wouldn’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Tuffin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact! Easy to use, I got it right the first time by scanning the instructions. I haven’t figured out how to roughly chop veggies yet (maybe it’s not able to?) as I found out when I destroyed a cucumber with two quick pulses. Worked great for mincing herbs and blending tomatoes for salsa. Can’t attest to durability yet but so far it seems like a solid addition to my kitchen! Can’t wait to try a smoothie in the blender.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good blender
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why they went from 3 blades to two, but it still blends well. Does require some technique for pulsing, not a turn it on and walk away kind of appliance. Care is needed when cleaning, as blades are very sharp. Does a good job for making smooth mixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Best blender ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect blender to make smoothies and protein shakes. Handles large ice cubes like they are jello. My Dentist put me on a soft food diet due to horrid TMJ and a knot in the jaw muscle. I promptly ordered this Ninja, bought fresh fruits, veggies, yogurt and protein powder. Now my morning smoothies are healthy and made in mere minutes (it would be seconds, but I have to spend a minute or two peeling bananas and adding the other ingredients). Once all items are in the Ninja (with the appropriate amount of liquid (I use almond milk and/or kale juice), I have a protein shake it seconds flat. Cleans up even faster. BEST BLENDER EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Goddess Nevermind

customer_reviews.title: i bought 3 of them. not because they suck, but because theyre awesome.
customer_reviews.text: great product, chops up and purees food items very well. i make smoothies, chop up nuts and cookies with the ninja. i puree soups and sauces, it does its job. i liked it so much that i bought one for my mom and mother in law. ive had mine now more about two years, and the blades have not gotten dull, and everything works well. the blades easily attach, and can be cleaned. if you have any back splash that gets up into the motor, just use a damn wash cloth to stick in the hole and clean out. you don't want that to get too gross.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Self destructive blender. If you like to eat plastic, buy this..
customer_reviews.text: The blades eat away at its own insides, I have definitely been eating and drinking plastics. Super sad.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice quiet blender.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for chopping cucumbers to make relish. Blends smoothies and fruit for canning jelly. Runs quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Works great, is quite, but doesn't chop small seeds
customer_reviews.text: Works quickly and is much quieter than I expected. Generally it blends things pretty well but it doesn't seem to cut through small seeds like strawberry seeds or flax seeds (and presumably other small seeds). I've tried making smoothies with these but the seeds all stay completely in tact. Luckily I can buy ground flax seeds and I don't really care that the strawberry seeds don't get chopped up...but I know some people do and may want them blended completely, in which case you may want to try a different blender.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for frozen drinks
customer_reviews.text: Handles frozen fruit, juice, yogurt, and ice like a champ! making frozen drinks is easy and convenient. Cleaning is easy with careful handling, i.e. do not forget to use common sense. All in all, in my opinion, much easier and convenient to use for frozen treats than a regular blender. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Desert_Knot

customer_reviews.title: Blade assembly are different.
customer_reviews.text: The blender on the 450 watt power pod had 3 levels of blades on the blender. The 400 watt only has two levels (lower) This still works fine for my needs but if you have plans on filling that pitcher to the top it might be worth the 8 bucks to get the 450 watt and get the extra blade. I paid 28 bucks for this and am happy with the purchase. (I really just needed an extra pitcher)
customer_reviews.author: Goodie

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: let me just say, i use amazon alot but never leave reviews. although this item needs one!! it was this or the nutirbullet for $70 , took a shot with this for $30 and am very pleased !!! very high quality, feels sturdy and well made. first time using it was really very happy. its built very well and operates perfectly! threw in about 15 large frozen strawberries, 2 full frozen bananas and a cup of almond milk, this thing made it into perfct texture and had no issue cutting right through all the frozen fruit wich regular blenders just chip away at... it slices through anything and am very satisfied and truly excited to us again! A+++++
customer_reviews.author: jacob gindi

customer_reviews.title: Trying to save money and improve my diet.  This helps.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to start making my own dry oatmeal for breakfasts I could just heat up at work. I grind up dehydrated fruits and add that, and a little powdered creamer to my oatmeal. I got the blender part because I figured I might as well try to start making smoothies. It does a great job making both.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Ninja 400-Watt Blender/Food Processor for Frozen Blending, Chopping and Food Prep with 48-Ounce Pitcher and 16-Ounce Chopper Bowl (QB900B), Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver

PRODUCT DETAIL OVERVIEW
NINJA MASTER PREP WITH PATENTED BLADE TECHNOLOGY
Put the power in the palm of your hand with the multi-talented Ninja Master Prep that crushes ice into snow in seconds, blends frozen fruits into creamy smoothies, and chops fresh ingredients evenly! Mince, dice, chop, blend, and puree for consistent results in the 16 oz (2 cup) chopper bowl and achieve perfect frozen blending in the 48 oz (6 cup) pitcher.

PULSE TECHNOLOGY
The interchangeable and ergonomic 400-watt power pod quickly switches between the 16-oz chopper bowl or 48-ounce pitcher for added versatility in the kitchen. The pod features a large one-touch pulsing button for ultimate control and consistent results.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Wide, no-slip bases and splashguards on the pitcher and chopper keep everything steady and clean. For added convenience, storage lids are included to keep your food fresh and all removable parts are dishwasher-safe.

PRODUCT SPECS
 * Ninja Master Prep (QB900B) 
 * Model - QB900B 
 * Power - 400 Watts 
 * Speeds - Pulse Technology 
 * Pitcher Capacity - 48 oz. (6 cups) 
 * Chopper Bowl Capacity - 16 oz. (2 cups) 
 * Blade Technology - Stacked blade technology 
 * Attachments - 4-blade and 6-blade set 
 * Warranty - 1 Year 
 * BPA Free 
 * Dishwasher Safe

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
Ninja Master Prep FamilyExpress Chop Professional (NJ110GR)Master Prep with 400 Watts (QB900B)Master Prep with 450 Watts (QB1000)Master Prep Professional(QB1004)400 Watts✓450 Watts✓✓16 oz Chopper Bowl✓✓✓✓48 oz Prep Pitcher✓✓✓40 oz Prep Bowl✓Chrome Button on Power Pod✓✓✓Stacked Blade Technology✓✓✓✓Storage Lid(s)✓✓✓✓ 

BRAND STORY
By Ninja
feature_bullets: Frozen blending and perfect, even chopping
2 conveniently sized jars; Easy to use : Ergonomic operation with one touch pulsing creates an easy to use and safe product
Anti spill splash guard, easy flip pour spout, and no slip base; 2 cup processor minces, dices, chops, blends and purees
Includes: 400 watt power pod, 48 ounce Pitcher, stacked blade assembly, pitcher splash guard, 16 ounce Chopper bowl, chopping blade assembly, chopper splash guard

Do not immerse the power head into water, or any other liquid; Use a damp sponge to wipe clean; Containers, splash guards, blades and storage lids are all dishwasher safe; It is recommended to place the blades, splash guards and storage lids on top rack of dishwasher; Use extreme caution when cleaning, and handling the blades; Always store blades in containers, or safe area; If the motor doesn't start, check that the plug is securely inserted into the electrical outlet; Check that the bowl splash guard and power pod are securely in place

specifications.Included Components: Ninja Master Prep, Dices, 2-Conveniently Sized Jars, Blends And Purees, 16-Ounce Master Prep Bowl, Chops, 2-Cup Processor Minces, 48-Ounce Master Prep Pitchers, 4-Blade And 6-Blade Set
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars9,010 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
